snippet: Israel’s population authority left Muhammad off the annual Top 10 list of baby names, even though it was No. 1, setting off a discussion about the status of the Arab minority.
abstract: Memo From Israel; Israel's population authority makes striking decision not to include Muhammad on annual Top 10 list of baby names, despite fact that it was by far the most popular name for children born that year; choice sets off discussion about status of Israel's Arab minority, which constitutes some 21 percent of the population.

byline.contributor: Said Ghazali and Irit Pazner Garshowitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Israel’s population authority left Muhammad off the annual Top 10 list of baby names, even though it was No. 1, setting off a discussion about the status of the Arab minority.

headline.main: A Conspicuous Absence on Israel’s List of Top Baby Names
headline.print_headline: A Conspicuous Absence on a List of Top Baby Names
